quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Jazz and Trumpeter
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, register, trumpet. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which trumpet player famous for his high register playing was featured in the Ellington Orchestra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Anderson

questions.question: What RB and soul musician performed the 2001 hit song Family Affair?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary J. Blige

questions.question: This musician has won a Grammy for a jazz album and for a classical album. He is the jazz director for Lincoln Center in New York City. He was very influential in the making of Ken Burns TV series on the history of jazz. What is the first name of this great trumpet player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wynton

questions.question: This trumpeter was the first bandleader that we know of that played improvised music. He was the top trumpeter of New Orleans of his time. He lived 1877-1931. His loud , clean tone was prominent in jazz until his health failed and he was committed to a mental institution in 1907. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddy Bolden

questions.question: The building at 1619 Broadway in New York City is also known by this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Brill Building

questions.question: This great trumpeter played professionally since age 12.He played with Benny Goodman for several years before forming his own group. Although he was a great musician he is perhaps best known for marrying Betty Grable.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry James

questions.question: A Florida-born trumpeter, this musician started playing with travelling dance bands right after high school graduation. From there went to play in several big bands in the 1940s. He took over for Dizzy Gillespie in Billy Eckstines band. Who was this jazz great who died in 1950 even before he was 28?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fats Navarro

questions.question: This group wrote the theme from The Monkees and Take the Last Train to Clarksville.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boyce and Hart

questions.question: Which of these last names of popular musician belongs to a jazz great known as Hot Lips?”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Page

questions.question: This great musician lived from 1911-1955. His great range and excellent tone were his trademarks as was his strange nickname. Who was this mainstay of the Duke Ellington Orchestra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cootie Williams

questions.question: Louis Armstrong is regarded by many to be the greatest jazz trumpeter. His life is a history of jazz music. Although he played many types of jazz, Louis Armstrong was known to disapprove of which form of jazz?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bebop

questions.question: The songs, written by this team include: Sweets for My Sweet, Viva Las Vegas, This Magic  Moment , Turn Me Loose and Suspicion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Schuman and Pomus

questions.question: Which writing team was responsible for the 1961 Shirelles hit Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goffin and King

questions.question: In 1978 this New Jersey-born trumpeter was voted Downbeats top trumpeter. His top albums are Rosewood, United and For Sure. Though he was a great musician he is better known by his peers than by the public at large. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woody Shaw

questions.question: Sometimes called Little Jazz,” this great trumpet player developed a jazz style that was similar to the sax styles of Bud Carter and Coleman Hawkins. Who was this jazz great who died in 1989 at age 88?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roy Eldridge

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Hits and Songs
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, supermodel. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He wrote such hits as A Little Bit of Soap, Piece of My Heart and Tell Him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bert Berns

questions.question: Who wrote Jailhouse  Rock, Love Potion #9 and There Goes My Baby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leiber and Stoller

questions.question: Hes a Rebel and Rubber Ball were just two of the hits, written by this songwriter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gene Pitney

questions.question: This Brooklyn-born singer/songwriter claims to have written 1,000 songs. Some of his hits were Calendar Girl and Stupid Cupid.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Sedaka

questions.question: Who wrote these hits: Hound Dog, Kansas City, Yakety Yak and On Broadway?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leiber and Stoller

questions.question: Who wrote  these  songs: Blame It on the Bossa Nova, Kicks, Who Put  the Bomp, Uptown and Walking in the Rain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mann and Weil

questions.question: What band wrote and recorded the 1966 song Paint It, Black?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

questions.question: How did Led Zeppelins 1971 song Black Dog get its title?

options.text: It was originally entitled Black Sheep, but later it was changed.
Some black dog walked around the studio as the band recorded the song.
At the time, bass player John Paul Jones had a black dog as a pet.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Some black dog walked around the studio as the band recorded the song.

questions.question: Which song-writing team gave us Tell Laura I Love Her, Then He Kissed Me, Be My Baby, and Baby I Love You?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry and Greenwich

questions.question: What supermodel appeared on the music video of Michael Jacksons 1991 song Black or White?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tyra Banks

questions.question: Smokey Joes Cafe features the songs of this writing team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leiber and Stoller

questions.question: This team produced several hits for Sam Cooke. Chain Gang was their biggest hit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hugo and Luigi

questions.question: Who performed the 1971 evergreen Lady in Black?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uriah Heep

questions.question: Which of these artists has covered the 1948 song Black Coffee?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What award did Will Smiths song 1997 Men in Black receive?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grammy Award

He had bought the bones of the Elephant Man.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and New York
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, tunings, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the Bluegrass music, although alternate tunings on guitar and banjo are commonplace (the low banjo string commonly alternates from C to D depending on song key), the fiddle always retains its standard G-D-A-E tuning.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What female musician recorded her song Hollywood in 2002, and released it in 2003?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madonna

questions.question: What popular band released the 1974 song Waterloo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ABBA

questions.question: Who performed the popular song New York, New York in Martin Scorseses 1977 movie New York, New York?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liza Minnelli

questions.question: This popular male musician wrote the 1973 song Knockin on Heavens Door?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dylan

questions.question: What 1999 song recorded by Sting features Algerian rai singer Cheb Mami?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Desert Rose

questions.question: Since a traditional bluegrass ensemble usually does not include a drummer (fiddle, guitar, banjo, mandolin, string bass), the musician playing the mandolin will sometimes mute the strings and strum off the beat to help keep time in a technique that has generally become known by what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chunking

questions.question: What inspired Michael Jackson to write his famous song Heal the World in the first place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The plight of wild animals

questions.question: What is the title of the power ballad written by Eric Clapton after his little son Conor died in 1991?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tears in Heaven

questions.question: Well you think all your anger is justified/ Me, I think its just your wounded pride.. Are these lyrics from the song Man To Man by country singer Gary Allan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What is the name of the band that recorded the 1974 song Sweet Home Alabama?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lynyrd Skynyrd

questions.question: Which of these musicians has covered the popular song Jailhouse Rock?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What famous rapper performed the 1995 song California Love together with Dr. Dre?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2Pac

questions.question: What is the missing part of this Bill Monroes well-known recording: The Muleskinner ______?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blues

questions.question: What is the most common alternate tuning for a guitar when playing bluegrass?

options.text: Tune the low E string down to D.
Tune the high E string down to D.
Tune all the strings down one whole step to be more in line with the banjo.
Tune the A string up to B; the D string up to E; and the G string up to G#.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tune the low E string down to D.
